description: Starts logging information, such as queries and connection attempts, for the specified Amazon Redshift cluster.

parameters.name: ClusterIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the cluster on which logging is to be started. Example: examplecluster.

parameters.name: BucketName
parameters.description: The name of an existing S3 bucket where the log files are to be stored. Constraints: Must be in the same region as the cluster The cluster must have read bucket and put object permissions.

parameters.name: S3KeyPrefix
parameters.description: The prefix applied to the log file names. Valid characters are any letter from any language, any whitespace character, any numeric character, and the following characters: underscore ( _), period ( .), colon ( :), slash ( /), equal ( =), plus ( +), backslash ( \), hyphen ( -), at symbol ( @).

parameters.name: LogExports
parameters.description: The collection of exported log types. Possible values are connectionlog, useractivitylog, and userlog. (string) ---

nested_items.name: LoggingEnabled
nested_items.description: true if logging is on, false if logging is off.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket where the log files are stored.

nested_items.name: S3KeyPrefix
nested_items.description: The prefix applied to the log file names.

nested_items.name: LastSuccessfulDeliveryTime
nested_items.description: The last time that logs were delivered.

nested_items.name: LastFailureTime
nested_items.description: The last time when logs failed to be delivered.

nested_items.name: LastFailureMessage
nested_items.description: The message indicating that logs failed to be delivered.

nested_items.name: LogDestinationType
nested_items.description: The log destination type. An enum with possible values of s3 and cloudwatch.

nested_items.name: LogExports
nested_items.description: The collection of exported log types. Possible values are connectionlog, useractivitylog, and userlog.
